poem:
**Seventeen Hours of Light**

A name breaks open on the street  
like a bag of flour—white, sudden, everywhere.  
They call him hero, say he was executed,  
say it's lies: officials, parents, strangers  
all tugging at the same torn sleeve.

Seventeen hours and four hundred thousand reasons  
to believe the dead can be carried  
in a hat passed hand to hand.
